class fusion_prod.cbd.ConformalBlocksBundle¶

Bases: object

A class representing a conformal blocks vector bundle.

Attributes:
liealg: simple lie algebra weights: list of weights level: positive integer
getRank()¶

Computes the rank of the conformal blocks bundle

intersect_F_curve()¶
class fusion_prod.cbd.IrrRep¶

Bases: object

This class represents an irreducible finite dimensional representation of a simple Lie algebra.

Attributes: liealg: object of type SimpleLieAlgebra; the simple Lie algebra acting on the representation high_weight: highest weight of the representation

get_dimension()¶
get_dominant_character()¶

Returns the dominant character of the representation. Implementation is heavily influenced by the implementation in the LiE system.

Return value: A dictionary where the keys are Weight objects and the values are positive integers corresponding to the multiplicity of the wt space.

class fusion_prod.cbd.Root¶

Bases: fusion_prod.cbd.Weight

This class represents an element of the root lattice of the given simple Lie algebra.

Attributes:
root_coords: coordinates in terms of the basis of simple roots of the Lie algebra
Inherited Attributes:
liealg: a SimpleLieAlgebra object, the algebra associated to the weight fund_coords: coordinates of the weight in terms of the basis of fundamental weights epsilon_coords: coordinates of the weight in terms of epsilon coordinates
get_root_level()¶
class fusion_prod.cbd.SimpleLieAlgebra¶

Bases: object

A template class for a simple Lie Algebra. Unimplemented methods must be implemented by subclasses of each type. Objects of this class should be constructed by creating an object of the appropriate subclass.

Attributes:
rank: a positive integer representing the Lie rank of the algebra. store_fusion: if true the lie algebra will save computed fusion products
add_weights()¶

Adds two weights and returns the sum as a new weight object

casimirScalar()¶
convert_epsilons_to_funds()¶
convert_funds_to_epsilons()¶
convert_funds_to_roots()¶
convert_roots_to_funds()¶
degree()¶
dual_coxeter()¶
fusion()¶

Computes the fusion product decomposition of the irreducible representations with highest weights wt1 and wt2 at level ell.

Parameters:
  • wt1 – A list or tuple of non-negative integers of length equal to self.rank; represents fundamental weight coordinates of the highest weight of the irreducible representation.
  • wt2 – Same as wt1.
  • ell – A positive integer; corresponds to the level of the fusion product.
Returns:

A dictionary with keys that are tuples of integers and values that are integers; the keys correspond to highest weights and the values are the multiplicities of the corresponding representation in the fusion product of wt1 and wt2.
get_dual_weight()¶
get_level()¶
get_orbit_iter()¶

Returns an iterable object that iterates through the Weyl group orbit of the given weight.

Parameters:
weight: weight whose orbit we want to traverse
Returns:
iterator object
get_positive_roots()¶

Returns a list of all positive roots of the Lie algebra.

get_rho()¶
get_weights()¶
killing_form()¶
length_squared()¶
multi_fusion()¶

Computes :param wts: :param level: :return:

reflect_to_alcove_with_parity()¶
reflect_to_chamber()¶
reflect_to_chamber_with_parity()¶
sub_weights()¶

Subtracts wt1 from wt2 the difference as a new weight object

tensor()¶

Computes the tensor product decomposition of the irreducible representations with highest weights wt1 and wt2.

Parameters:
  • wt1 – A list or tuple of non-negative integers of length equal to self.rank; represents fundamental weight coordinates of the highest weight of the irreducible representation.
  • wt2 – Same as wt1.
Returns:

A dictionary with keys that are tuples of integers and values that are integers; the keys correspond to highest weights and the values are the multiplicities of the corresponding representation in the tensor product of wt1 and wt2.

class fusion_prod.cbd.Weight¶

Bases: list

This class represents a weight of a given simple Lie algebra. The class contains methods that are type-independent.

Attributes:
liealg: a SimpleLieAlgebra object, the algebra associated to the weight epsilon_coords: coordinates of the weight in terms of epsilon coordinates

Methods:

isDominant()¶

Checks if the weight is dominant
